Episodes.Title: Louder Than Words
Episodes.Plot: Tom Kane cements his mayoral legacy with a lavish ceremony celebrating the groundbreaking of the new modernized O'Hare terminals. Now Kane looks to the future, setting his sights on reviving a subsidized housing project. While his political future seems bright, Kane continues to battle for control over his disease.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: Violence, nudity, sex scenes & offensive language

Episodes.Title: Through and Through
Episodes.Plot: Kane uses personal tragedy to further his agenda, poaches his nemesis's aide, Mona, and hires ambitious newcomer Ian - but will they be enough to fill the void that Stone left behind?
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: Violence, nudity, sex scenes & offensive language

Episodes.Title: Ablution
Episodes.Plot: Kane's increasing infatuation with his new aide Mona leads him to get swept up in her enthusiasm for a housing-redevelopment project.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: Violence, nudity, sex scenes & offensive language

Episodes.Title: Redemption
Episodes.Plot: Kane attempts to clean house and deep-sixes longtime political cronies, while at home, Meredith and Emma want no part of a family reunion with him.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: Violence, nudity, sex scenes & offensive language

Episodes.Title: Mania
Episodes.Plot: Kane's corruption sweep threatens his political hold over the City Council. His mental symptoms begin to spiral out of control - Kane can no longer tell what is a hallucination and what is reality.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: Violence, offensive language, drug use & sexual material

Episodes.Title: Backflash
Episodes.Plot: Kane's moves with the housing project escalate tensions from unrest to rioting and looting. As Chicago burns, Kane secretly seeks treatment at an alternative clinic, where his past haunts him.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: Violence, offensive language, drug use & sexual material

Episodes.Title: The Conversation
Episodes.Plot: Kane's alternative treatment seems to have worked and he is back in control of his city. Now he must remedy his public perception, even if it means making an old friend collateral damage.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: Violence, offensive language, drug use & sexual material

Episodes.Title: Consequence
Episodes.Plot: Kane reluctantly enters an alliance with a longtime foe on City Council, but he soon realizes that more serious measures must be undertaken to stave off bankruptcy.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: Violence, offensive language, drug use & sexual material

Episodes.Title: Clinch
Episodes.Plot: Chicago's bankruptcy crisis means a loss of power for Kane as emergency measures are put in place, but threats by his enemies to expose him could be of even greater concern.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: Sex scenes, violence, drug use and offensive language

Episodes.Title: True Enough
Episodes.Plot: Miller publishes a story that could destroy Kane, but Kane's biggest threat is Kitty's alliance with Doyle. As Meredith forms a new relationship, Kane goes to the greatest lengths yet to stay on top.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: Sex scenes, violence, drug use and offensive language
